resources.string:
- Click on connection info button to change it.
 - Click on Connect button to start/stop communication.
 - Use the TX-Type Label to select what kind of data you want to send.
 - Write on the TX input the information you want to send.
 - On Text Mode, user can enable to append CR+LF during send operation.
 - If enabled, 'Append CR+LF' bytes will be sent even if TX-Input is empty.
 - Use the app menu to access other options:
 * Select how to show and manage the incoming data 'RX▼'.
 * Select advanced numeric reception options (int16, int32, float,..).
 * Start/Stop FastSend Interface.
 * Start Xtring Interface.
 * Enter Settings Screen.
 - Settings Screen have additional options:
 * Select appearance options: Light or Dark theme.
 * Clear TX input after Send if needed.
 * Change Number of Static and Scrollable FastSend Buttons.
 * Change byte order (endian) when sending multiByte numbers.
 - Tablet users can select the reception options without entering to menu.
 - In WiFi Server mode, net port should be greater or equal to 1100 to avoid ports used by the system.

- LongClick on Connect button to show/hide ActionBar.(PRO)
 - Slide the ActionBar Down/Up to respectively Show/Hide it.(PRO)
 - When connected, LongClick on 'Send' button to Show/Hide FastSend Interface without entering to menu.
 - Also can Show/Hide FastSend Interface by Sliding respectively from/to the right side of the screen.
 - Start Xtring mode by sliding from left side of the screen to the right.

Operating 'FastSend Interface': Save data in to buttons to send it with a single click.
 * Select from TX-Type Label the kind of data you want to save on a FastSend Button.
 * Write data on the TX-Input.
 * Start FastSend mode (if not running yet).
 * LongClick on one FastSend Button to save the TX data on the button.
 * Simple Click on FastSend Button to automatically send the saved data.
 * If TX-Input is empty, LongClick on a FastSend Button will erase saved data.
 * FastSend Buttons will show type and data you just save.
 * Pro users have Unlimited FastSend Buttons instead of 8. Change Quantities in Settings Screen.

Operating 'Xtring Interface': Save an organized group of various types of data to send it as a package.
 * By pressing the 'Add Item' button you will be prompted to select a type of data.
 * The enabled Send-Types are the same as normal operation on the principal screen.
 * After selecting the type, a new screen will appear to write the desired Data.
 * Finishing this, your just created XtringItem will be shown in the list.
 * You can press the 'Type Label' of any item to change it's type.
 * You can press the 'Data Label' of any item to modify it's Data value.
 * You can define constant items to avoid replacing precious information
 * You can delete the last package item by pressing the 'Delete Item' Button.
 * If some item data is empty 'No_Dat' the package will not be sent and you be prompted to write into the first empty item.
 * Press the Send Button to start the package transmission and return to the Principal Screen.
 * Finish Xtring Mode(without sending a package) by sliding from the right side of the screen to the left or pressing Back.
 * The package template and the actual values will be automatically saved on device memory.
 * Pro users have Unlimited Xtring Items instead of 10.
 * Pro users can select items to ignore during the send operation.
 * Pro users can return automatically to the Xtring screen after sending the package by activating the CheckBox.
 * Pro users can save Xtring Packages in FastSend Buttons by selecting the option on the menu or a LongClick on the Send Button.
 * The known FastSend interface will appear with a upper TextInput to define the Button name, be sure to have no empty Xtring Items.

Operating 'Advanced Reception' types: Receive and show big numbers (16, 32 and 64 bit integers) and float, double numbers (32 and 64 bit).
 * Requires the sender device to send a start byte = 13.
 * Then send the data bytes in order from MSB to LSB.
 * And finally send an end byte = 10.

Operating 'Package Reception': New incoming data will replace the old one.
 * Requires the connected device to send a package End byte = 10.
 * Select the 'Package Reception' Reception Type.
 * Write number of received packages to accumulate before replacing with new ones (empty means 1).
 * Enable/Disable byte reception if desired by using the CheckBox.
 - 'Package Reception' mode can be mixed with the advanced reception types:
 * First select 'Package Reception'.
 * Then select the advanced reception type to be interpreted and showed.

Support Us installing the Virtual Terminal PROkey app, you will obtain:
 * Server working mode for WiFi and Bluetooth, letting you debug other communication apps or exchange data with clients connected to your device.
 * Long and Double Send/Receive Data Types.
 * Enhanced FastSend Interface unlimited button and Configurable Quantities.
 * Enhanced Xtring Interface with unlimited items and new options.
 * Save the Xtring packages as FastSend Buttons to use from the principal Screen.
ProKey BetaTest finished, thank you for participating
Your Device do not have Bluetooth
Wait until WiFi Connection is Established
Failed to Connect to desired IP and Port after 7sec
Can\'t open desired port, please try another
Server Port lower than 1100 could be system reserved
Same End Byte for Package Reception
Press Back to exit Tutorial or select the option from menu.

- Here is the Principal Interface of Virtual Terminal.
 - Take a moment to see it and play with the buttons if you want.
 - Also you can enter to the menu, look out for the RX▼ Button.
 - The I/O Configuration Screen should appear when RX▼ is pressed.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to start the guide.

- This button is used to configure where you will connect.
 - In Bluetooth mode, it shows the list of paired devices to select one.
 - In WiFi mode, it shows editable IP address and port, be sure to write the correct one.
 - A LongClick should open the configuration screen.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- This button is used to start a connection to the specified Device/Address.
 - The text on it will change based on the situation or connection state.
 - If connection can't be done, the process will be canceled within 7 seconds.
 - Pro users can use a LongClick to hide/show the ActionBar.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- This "Send Type" Label can be pressed to open the I/O configuration screen.
 - It is possible to send text, bytes, bigger numbers with 2 or more bytes and floats.
 - Also you will notice a format menu on the I/O screen, for writing in Binary or Hexadecimal.
 - Give it a try and press!, it is at the left of the "Vagos CORP" TX-Input.
 - This "Send Type" Label will change it's text based on your selection.
 - IO Config Screen has a FastButton to configure the Reception type.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- This checkBox let you append the CR and LF characters to your message.
 - It is enabled only when sending text, marking the end of line.
 - When sending numeric data it gets disabled.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- This ⚠ label notifies about the sending order of the bytes when sending a number.
 - More precisely a number formed by more than 8 bits, like a short(16) or a float(32).
 - This label Will be shown automatically based of the selected Send-Type.
 - Big Endian means Most significant byte is sent first, Otherwise it is Little Endian.
 - Big Endian is the default send order, Pro Users can change it from settings.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- This is the TX-Input for the data to send.
 - The hint and characters allowed will change based on the Send-Type selection.
 - By default the Send-Type is text, you can try to write on it now if desired.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- Now the TX-Input behavior is set for numbers.
 - The allowed characters are shown on the hint.
 - Also the keyboard now should show only numbers, try it if desired.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- Now the TX-Input behavior is set for numbers in hexadecimal.
 - The allowed characters are shown on the hint.
 - Also the keyboard now should show all characters but will filter the inputs.
 - You can try to write on it, characters greater than F will be ignored.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- Now the TX-Input behavior is set for numbers in binary.
 - The allowed characters are shown on the hint.
 - Also the keyboard now should show only numbers but will filter the inputs.
 - You can try to write on it, characters greater than 1 will be ignored.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- Now the TX-Input behavior is set for decimal numbers(float).
 - The allowed characters are shown on the hint.
 - Also the keyboard now should show only numbers, try to write on it if desired.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- This button is used to send the actual content of the TX-Input.
 - The send operation will use the specified Send-Type and options applied.
 - You can enable to erase automatically the TX-Input content after send on settings.
 - A LongClick will open or close the FastSend Interface, try it!.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- The FastSend interface is a group of configurable buttons for 'Fast Data send'.
 - Every button can hold a value with the selected Send-Type.
 - A longClick on a button will save the actual content of TX-Input on it.
 - After save, the button text will show the type and content stored on it.
 - A button press will automatically send the stored data to the connected device.
 - A longClick with an empty TX-Input will erase the stored value.
 - An empty FastSend button has a "NoDat" text saved, it can be sent too.
 - Pro users can configure the Button quantity from the settings Screen.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- This two buttons can erase the content of the TX-Input and RX-View respectively.
 - For TX-Input, it is faster than erasing with the keyboard.
 - For RX-View, it is the only way to clear the reception screen.
 - Unless you are using an advanced reception type like 'Package RX'.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- You are looking this text on the RX-View, all data received is shown here.
 - Just like the Send-Type, you can use the menu button RX▼ to set the Reception-Type.
 - You have the same options as the Send-Type plus two new ones meant for RX.
 - 'Dual RX' Mode let you see the received data as text and as bytes at the same time.
 - 'Package RX' Mode will wipe the RX-View once a defined package quantity is received.
 - Data Packages are recognized by the last byte received, if EndByte = 10, that is a package.
 - After the RX-View wipe, the count will restart, allowing to see only last data.
 - 'Package RX' can be mixed with all numeric Reception-Types to see realtime values.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- This text input and checkbox let you manage the 'Package RX' Mode.
 - The text input defines the max number of packages before RX Wipe(1 is default).
 - The checkbox opens the numeric RX-View to see data just like 'Dual RX' Mode.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- Down there, you can see the mentioned Numeric RX-View.
 - It is enabled with all numeric Receive-Types, Dual and Package Modes.
 - To Receive a multi-byte number, you need to add a start and end byte to your data.
 - StartByte = 13 and EndByte = 10, the app will threat the in-between bytes as the selected type.
 - Being the EndByte = 10 allows the mix between the package and the numeric modes.
 - When using this advanced reception modes, the app will always wait for the EndByte.
 - Or in numeric mode, for the maximum number of bytes of the selected receive-type.
 - Press the 'Next' Button to continue.

- Use the instructions for more information, can find them on the menu.
 - In the menu you will notice the 'Xtring Interface' option.
 - The Xtring Interface let you create a list of data to be sent in sequence.
 - Press Back to exit Tutorial or select the option from menu.

- In the menu you will notice the Xtring Interface option.
 - The Xtring Mode let you create a list of data to be sent in sequence.
 - By pressing the 'Add Item' button you will be prompted to select a type of data.
 - The enabled Send-Types are the same as normal operation on the principal screen.
 - After selecting the type, a new screen will appear to write the desired Data.
 - Finishing this, your just created XtringItem will be shown in the list.
 - You can press the 'Type Label' at any moment to change the type of any item.
 - You can press the 'Data Label' at any moment to change the Data value of any item.
 - You can delete the last item by pressing the 'Delete Item' button.
 - You can send the entire list/package of data by pressing the 'Send' button.
 - Pro Users can open the FastSend Interface by a LongClick on 'Send' or Select it from the menu.
 - Press Back to exit Tutorial or select the option from menu.
